title: Stimulated Raman Activated Cell Sorting
excerpt: A new way to sort cells based on their chemical composition using advanced optical techniques.

content.text: Cell sorting is essential for many biological applications. Our new approach uses stimulated Raman spectroscopy for label-free cell sorting.
Our study has been reported by FIO+LS:Scientists invent new way to sort cells by type using light and Raman spectroscopy improves single-cell sorting
Our paper can be found at Science Advances 2024. adn6373

content.caption: Overview of the Stimulated Raman Activated Cell Sorting system.
Target identification based on Raman profile with spatial constrains.
Downstream analysis of the sorted cells.

content.text: This technique allows for high-throughput analysis and sorting of cells based on their intrinsic chemical properties without the need for labels or markers.
The system can detect metabolic differences in cellular composition, enabling new applications in cancer research, stem cell biology, and pharmaceutical development.
